H0.text: The tilt of Earth on its axis is the primary factor causing seasons in Alaska as Earth revolves around the Sun.

H1.text: The rate of rotation of Earth is the factor that primarily causes seasons in Alaska as Earth revolves around the Sun.

H2.text: The effects of solar flare activity are the factor that primarily causes seasons in Alaska as Earth revolves around the Sun.

H3.text: The relative distance between Earth and the Sun is the primary factor causing seasons in Alaska as Earth revolves around the Sun.

A4.text: the axial tilt of the Earth accounts for most of the seasonal variation in climate in both hemispheres

A5.text: the seasons are not the result of the variation in Earth's distance to the Sun because of its elliptical orbit
